Text: So...you want to vanish?
Vanish?

Isn't that what you said will happen once we smash
the core?

Yes. But it will be closer to being set free than to
vanishing.
Violet smiles without looking my way.

This is a prison where memories are replayed on an
endlessly repeating loop.
I find it...a tad unbearable.
Gotcha.
Then let's wait a bit longer.
Wait...?
If we wait, something might happen.

(If we're goin' by the book, this is right about when
the main character should show up.)
Ah!
(Speak of the devil!)

(Behold, the one of heroic lineage, the one fit to
draw the sacred blade...)
...Baldy?!
Baldy...!

Maybe this is the version where the bad guy arrives
before the good guy to cause trouble...
Now what's my best move here...
Hm?
Is something wrong?

Oh, it's just that elf is a dead ringer for my
friend...
But...it's not her.
Oho, so you have Aurora in tow...
You know this bald guy?

No... I've never seen him before. But...my memories
are fragmented, so it's possible I may have met him
at some point.
Hahahaha!

What a terrible shame. That door will not open for
the likes of you!
And you, boy, are most unfortunate.
Me?

I don't know where you stumbled in from, but joining
hands with that witch means you will die…
at the edge of Olivier's blade here.
The elf babe steps forward on Baldy's order.
What?!
This is bad... She's—
I know. She's powerful.
We have to run...!
Why?

Do not blame me, blame that vixen there with you.
And your own idiocy...!

Olivier draws a blade that is the mirror image of the
one in the pedestal.
Her dull, glassy eyes are fixed solely on Cid.

The battle commences with a blow that sends him
flying.
Cid slams into the stone wall with terrible force.

Although he is about to collapse, Olivier gives him
no quarter.

Her onslaught is merciless and leaves no room for a
counterattack.

Cid is launched into the air, defenseless, and then
sent flying by another sword strike from the hero.

Though he manages to block with his own blade at the
last second, the impact sends him hurtling backward.

This can not be called a fight. It is much too
one-sided.

However, that is to be expected. This is not an issue
of technique or skill. No, Olivier is fundamentally on
another level when it comes to raw strength, speed,
and stamina.

Just as an infant stands no chance against an adult,
it is painfully obvious that this is what happens
when a boy unable to wield magic goes up against
a hero who can.

It is a miracle that the battle had not ended with
the first blow.
What is that insolent look for? Why are you smiling?!

Prompted by the question, Cid touches his cheek.
It is true—he is smiling.
...Hey, you're right. I really am smiling.

There is nothing so tedious as a wretch who does not
know his place. You have only your fool's luck to
thank for the fact that you're still breathing!
Olivier strikes.
It is a horizontal slash aimed directly at Cid's neck.
He only just barely manages to avoid the attack.
However, Olivier slides behind him effortlessly.

No counter, parry, dodge, or anything will be quick
enough.
A spray of blood erupts from Cid's back.

Skin was split and flesh was sliced, but he is able
to avoid a fatal wound.
Absurd... Why are you still alive?!
Fights with no conversation are monotonous.
What?!

She doesn't have a mind of her own, so she can't
respond to my questions.
What are you blathering on about?
Olivier! Kill him at once!
Stop!
Huh?
Stop all of this.
Why?

This is not a foe you can defeat. I don't recall why
I know this.

Aurora's memory is fragmented. All of her life after
a certain point is lost to her.

Though Olivier doesn't appear in the memories that do
remain, Aurora can somehow sense the danger the hero
represents. She doesn't know this woman, but the terror
in her heart suggests she once did.
That's why she is so desperate to put a stop to this.
Contrary to her wishes, though, Cid keeps fighting.

The fleeting hope that he may be able to win is what
had kept her from speaking up sooner.

Even in a tournament for people who can't use magic,
can't I beat her?
No... This has gone far enough.

You've given me a memory beyond
what I could have ever hoped for.

Aurora had gone through life treated only with
contempt, never having anyone risk their own
life for hers.

This experience, which she she will never forget,
is all she could ask for.
Hm?
There is no need for you to die.
Huh?
I can manage on my own from here.
What?

Hehehe... And just what can a witch bereft of magic
hope to do?
I'm sure I can at least help him escape.
Aurora places herself in front of Cid.

A witch, pleading for someone's life? Now I really
have seen everything. Regardless...if you agree
to cooperate, I suppose I can spare the boy.
Cooperate? What do you mean?

Hmph, ah yes, you and that faulty memory of yours.
Nevertheless, all you need do is give your word that
you will do as we ask. Your continued refusal has set
us back greatly.
...I understand.
Hey, at least give me a say in this.
As Cid attempts to interject, Aurora turns to him.
But I'm doing this for your sake...!
No need for that.

I've been listening to everything you said so far,
but I'd really appreciate it if you guys didn't talk
like I'm gonna lose.
Have you taken leave of your senses?

I am saying that if she does as I ask, I will let you
leave with your life.
And I'm saying there's no need for that.
Here, I'll show you.
Wait!!!
Enough of this! Kill him!!!

The blindingly fast thrust tears through the very
air itself on a path straight for Cid's abdomen.
It finds its mark and runs through cruelly.
Even while impaled, a grin appears Cid's bloody face.
...Gotcha.
